language.name: en
language.string: The calendar could not be found!
A validation ruleset could not be determined; Please check the validator name.
There were %1 tests, and only %2 were run; %3 tests did not run.
Validates iCalendars against the IETF standards in a strict fashion. Any variations from the standard will be reported.

Validates iCalendars against the IETF standards, ensuring compatibility between known calendaring applications whenever possible. Any practices that are known to break certain calendaring applications will be reported.

errors.error: The calendar test expected no errors, but one or more errors occurred:
The calendar test expected exactly one error (%1), but none occurred.
The calendar test expected an error (%1), but failed with a different error than was expected (%2).
The calendar test expected exactly one error (%1), but received more than one.
The calendar could not be loaded.
It appears that this line has not been "folded" properly according to the iCalendar standard.
The calendar could not be parsed due to a serious error in the structure of the calendar: %1
Empty lines are not compatible with all applications.
Line endings must be a Carriage Return/Line Feed (CRLF) pair.
The %1 property is required on all %2 components.
The %1 property may only be defined once on a %2 component.
The %1 property may only be defined between %3 and %4 times on a %2 component.
The %1 property on %2 components does not officially support the value %3. The following are defined values: %4.
The %1 property is missing on the %2 component. Was this intentional?
The VERSION property is required on all VCALENDAR components.
The VERSION property may only be defined once on a VCALENDAR component.
The VERSION property is invalid; it must be a version number (i.e. "2.0").
The VERSION property should be the first property on the calendar. Some calendar clients cannot properly parse the calendar otherwise.
Only calendars version 2.0 or higher are allowed.
Inline binary content should only be used in special circumstances that demand the iCalendar be expressed as a single object.
Events MUST only have a DTEND or DURATION, they cannot have both.
The %1 property is invalid; backslashes must be escaped in text fields.
The %1 property is invalid; commas must be escaped in text fields.
The %1 property is invalid; semicolons must be escaped in text fields.
The %1 inline encoding is deprecated, and will not work correctly in all applications.
The %1 is not a valid inline encoding.
The date value '%1' may be out-of-range in some applications.
The VNOTE component is deprecated, and is not officially part of the iCalendar 2.0 standard.
The time zone with the TZID '%1' was not found.
The value appears to be a 'date-time' value, but 'VALUE=DATE' was specified.
The value appears to be a 'date' value, but 'VALUE=DATE' was not specified.
'%1' is not a valid value type.
The 'date' value '%1' is not formatted properly.
The 'date-time' value '%1' is not formatted properly.
The value '%1' is not a valid URI. The following message contains more information: '%2'

resolutions.resolution: Insert a SPACE or horizontal TAB (US-ASCII decimal 32, or US-ASCII decimal 9, respectively) at the beginning of the line.
Remove empty lines from the iCalendar.
Ensure all line endings are CRLF pairs (US-ASCII decimal 13, followed by US-ASCII decimal 10).
Add a %1 property to the %2.
Ensure only one %1 property exists on each %2 component. See RFC 5545 section 4.7.4 for details.
Ensure the %1 property occurs between %3 and %4 times on each %2 component.
Use one of the following defined values on the %1 property: %4.
Add the %1 property to the %2 component.
Add the VERSION property to the VCALENDAR component.
Ensure only one VERSION property exists on the VCALENDAR component, and remove any duplicates.
Ensure the VERSION property is a valid version number (i.e. "2.0").
Place the VERSION property as the first line after "BEGIN:VCALENDAR".
Ensure the VERSION property is "2.0" or higher.
See RFC 5545 Section 4.1.3 for details.
Include only DTEND or DURATION on the event, but not both together.
Escape backslashes in the text field using two backslash characters instead (i.e. "\\").
Escape commas in the text field using a backslash followed by a comma (i.e. "\,").
Escape semicolons in the text field using a backslash followed by a semicolon (i.e. "\;").
Use another encoding (or no encoding at all) instead of the %1 inline encoding. See RFC 5545 section 4.2.7 for details.
Use another encoding (or no encoding at all) instead of the %1 inline encoding. See RFC 5545 section 4.2.7 for details.
On 32-bit Unix systems, ensure the date is between 1901-12-13 and 2038-01-19.
On systems using the .NET Framework or Mono, ensure the date is between 0001-01-01 and 9999-12-31.
On Microsoft SQL Server, ensure the date is between 1753-01-01 and 2079-06-06.
Consider using VJOURNAL instead.
Ensure the corresponding VTIMEZONE for TZID '%1' is contained in the calendar.
Remove the 'VALUE=DATE' parameter.
Remove the time portion of the date-time value, if it is not needed. See RFC 5545 section 3.3.5 for details.
Add a 'VALUE=DATE' parameter to the date-time value. See RFC 5545 section 3.3.5 for details.
Remove the 'VALUE=%1' parameter, or use one of the following VALUE types: %2
Format the date using the 'YYYYMMDD' format. See RFC 5545 section 3.3.5 for details.
Format the date-time using the 'YYYYMMDDTHHMMSS' format. See RFC 5545 section 3.3.5 for details.
Format the URI according to Internet-standard URI specifications (see Section 3 of RFC 3986).
